content.description: Nice problem with moves on bigger more comfortable crimps
content.location: Sit start on low crimps and move up to a crimp rail then to jugs

content.description: Good holds lead to holds that are….good enough to finish the problem.
content.location: Stand start at right edge of the cave in ledge/pocket/crimps in the seam and move direct up.

content.description: Cool techy movement on big holds
content.location: Start on an undercling jug and move left to a sidepull undercling jug then go direct up

content.description: Deadpoints. Stand start matched in a big pocket at the left of the cave. Move up and right to a incut crimp, then direct up through small holds.
content.location: Stand start matched in a big pocket at the left of the cave. Move up and right to a incut crimp, then direct up through small holds.

content.description: These are the problems to the very left. They are the easiest lines on the boulder and provide decent warmups, but the rock can get chossy here so be careful!
content.location: Furthest left section of the boulder

content.description: Wild start leads to a move that can only be described as the phantom peddle. Continue moving left and up for a very exciting finish.
content.location: Start in the hollowed out section with a right hand crimp and a left hand palm smear.

content.description: Start low on crimps and pull through holds you dont want to pull through to a fun last move
content.location: Sit start low with a higher left hand crimp on the lio of the bulge and a low right hand crimp below the bulge

content.description: Nice starting holds lead to death crimps with great feet and body positioning opportunities.
content.location: Sit start on a low undercling and move direct up

content.description: Nice traverse on good holds leads into Pearl Shine
content.location: Start in Pockets out left from Pearl Shine and traverse into the finish

content.description: Techy body positioning on bad holds
content.location: Stand start right of the cave in ledge/pocket/crimps at the seam. Move left through pockets up to a left hand crimp then direct up.

content.description: beauteous fist and hands limestone splitter screaming to be climbed. go up and down the same way.
content.protection: pads or your ability not to fall
content.location: obvious crack in the cove to the right of the main climbs with slabby face to the right.
Near the far right end of the boulder. Start with a right hand in a pocket and left hand in a sidepull pocket. Move direct up.

content.description: This boulder currently hosts the highest concentration of harder problems in Iowa. It has a slightly bulging base and becomes vertical. Great start holds and a nice jug seam separated by very small holds. These problems are all drop offs. Landings vary in safety. Bring as many pads as you can. The boulder is about 40ft long and sits underneath a very large roof. It is kept dry from rain. Oh and the area is haunted. If you see a rose on the ground….RUN.
